entry.title: Only RegisterPCAService once
entry.content:
This bug is found by https://crrev.com/c/4856732.

Normally, in each tab, TabAndroid::InitWebContents is only called once. So RegisterPCAService[1] will be called once as well.



But if TabImpl::swapWebContents is called, the method

TabAndroid::InitWebContents will be called again, then

RegisterPCAService[1] will be called again as well, and eventually,

the NOTREACHED[2] will be hit.



RegisterPCAService[1]. ->

page_content_annotations_service_->AddObserver[3]. ->

page_content_annotations_observers_[annotation_type].AddObserver(observer) [4]. ->

NOTREACHED[2].



[1]:

https://crsrc.org/c/chrome/browser/ui/tab_helpers.cc;l=418;drc=150d8c7e45daeef094be8ec8852e3486eed8f59d;bpv=1;bpt=1?q=tab_helpers.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



[2]:

https://crsrc.org/c/base/observer_list.h;l=284;drc=150d8c7e45daeef094be8ec8852e3486eed8f59d;bpv=1;bpt=1



[3]:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/android/persisted_tab_data/sensitivity_persisted_tab_data_android.cc;l=22;drc=150d8c7e45daeef094be8ec8852e3486eed8f59d;bpv=1;bpt=1



[4]:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/optimization_guide/content/browser/page_content_annotations_service.cc;l=894;drc=150d8c7e45daeef094be8ec8852e3486eed8f59d;bpv=1;bpt=1

entry.title: Status Area: Ensure only one shelf pod bubble is open at a time.
entry.content:
Currently, opening a bubble through keyboard shortcuts can result in 2

bubbles open at a time, which also makes the cache pointer

open_shelf_pod_bubble() in StatusAreaWidget become invalid. We fix this

by closing any open bubble when a new one comes in. This requires us to

implement HideBubble() in every class to make sure the function works on

every bubble.

entry.title: Moved DisabledAcceleration tests to the accelerated test fixture
entry.content:
These tests can't really test if acceleration was disabled if it was

never enabled in the first place. The only reason these worked was

because:

- The UpdateGPUMemoryUsage test is actually disabled.

- The RestoreCanvasMatrixClipStack never actually creates a

CanvasResourceProvider, so the raster mode config was never actually

used. This will change in a follow up CL, where a provider will get

created.

entry.title: media/gpu: Fix descriptor set layout bindings in vulkan image processor
entry.content:
Currently in the VulkanImageProcessorBackend, the descriptor set layout

bindings do not much the actual descriptor writes we perform in image

processing. Apparently some Vulkan drivers are more tolerant of this

than others, since this breaks on Corsola but not Cherry, which is how

the issue went unnoticed. This CL fixes the descriptor set layout

bindings.



Bug: b/251458823

Test: Tested by running video.ImageProcessor.image_processor_unit_test

on Cherry, Corsola, Jacuzzi, Trogdor.

entry.title: Add basic handling of race to the PlusAddressClient's SimpleUrlLoaders.
entry.content:
The PlusAddressClient now supports multiple calls to the creation flow

at once by creating a new SimpleUrlLoader for each request. The syncing

flow will still use a single SimpleUrlLoader since those calls are

spaced out and cannot race to the loader.

entry.title: Pad aggregatable reports with null contributions
entry.content:
Adds null contributions, i.e. contributions with zero value, to report

payloads when serializing to ensure that the number of contributions is

fixed (according to the calling API's request). This prevents the size

of the encrypted payload from leaking any information about the number

of contributions.



This functionality is guarded behind a disabled-by-default feature and

will be enabled in a separate cl. In that cl, we will update the golden

report tests.



See the corresponding spec changes here:

entry.title: [QuickStart] Handle optional UserVerificationMethod packet
entry.content:
Android introduced a new UserVerificationMethod packet that may be sent,

but only on newer versions of GMSCore. We need to gracefully handle

either case where the packet may be present or may not.



The TryDecodeData() method introduced here is a temporary stopgap to

allow handling optional packets. We need this fix in place now to

unblock bug bashes for the feature, but a larger refactor of

QuickStartDecoder to allow doing this in a simpler way is in progress.

entry.title: Centralize canvas recording initialization
entry.content:
Before this CL, the recording initialization and the canvas clip stack

restoration was performed "manually", by each and every functions

triggering a flush or a reset of the canvas. This manual maintenance

was error-prone because it was distributing the recording state

maintenance across the code base. New callers of

`recorder_->finishRecordingAsPicture()` for instance would have to

know to restore the recording and do it correctly.



With this change, the `MemoryManagedPaintRecorder`, which owns the

recording, takes care of keeping that recording initialized and valid.



Bug: 1484741

entry.title: arc/gio: Fix a regression crash bug when showing GC UIs
entry.content:
This CL fixes the crash when GC UIs show up. For example, when disabling

and enabling GC, then input mapping should show up, but it crashes.

When entering edit mode, EditingList should show up, but it crashes.

This is because GameDashboardMainMenu has set_close_on_deactivate(true).

Once GC widgets call Show(), it causes focus issue. So once GC

UIs/widgets show up, show them as inactive and then the user

interfaction makes them active.



- hiding and showing input mapping

- disabling and enabling GC

- entering into edit mode

entry.title: [Subresource filter] Add recommenders UMAs to cluster telemetry test.
entry.content:
The distribution of subresource filter has been automated using Omaha

Release rollout.



The rollout recommenders use some UMAs that are not currently in the

cluster telemetry test. This CL adds them to the cluster telemetry

benchmark. So we can take a look at the results from cluster telemetry

run before we start the rollout.



Add the 2 UMAs used by the rollout recommenders.

1. PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.Total2

2. SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.MatchedRules



Note: There is another UMA, WebVitals.FirstContentfulPaint3, that is

used by the recommender. However, it is a Google3 UMA, not Chromium. I

have tried running with:

--additional-histograms=WebVitals.FirstContentfulPaint3



The output does not show this UMA in the end. So it appears Google3

UMA is not supported.



https://ct.skia.org/results/cluster-telemetry/tasks/benchmark_runs/xiaochenzh-ChromiumAnalysis-6429/consolidated_outputs/xiaochenzh-ChromiumAnalysis-6429.output



Corrected the existing UMAs' names:

1. PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Cpu.AdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage

-> PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Cpu.AdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage2

2. PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Cpu.FullPage.TotalUsage

-> PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Cpu.FullPage.TotalUsage2



Their names seem have been modified but the script was not updated to

keep in sync. Verified in the output link above by putting them in

--additional-histograms.



Bug: 1486948

entry.title: Update events to handle disappearing sessions
entry.content:
The KeyStatusChange and ExpirationUpdate events are deferred, so they

may be run after the session has been removed (causing a crash).

Updating the events to properly handle the case where the session no

longer exists by ignoring the event if the session is gone.

entry.title: Keep SyncReader and AudioDeviceThread in sync on failed socket writes
entry.content:
Fix was verified like this:

1) Start playing song on soundcloud

2) Find the process id of the renderer

3) kill -STOP

4) Wait 20 seconds

5) kill -CONT



Result without fix: Audio remains silent after CONT

Result with fix: Audio resumes after CONT

entry.title: Reland "heap: Drop young wrappers for ASWs with pending activity"
entry.content:
The CL was reverted tentatively to fix a P1 stability issue. It's

unlikely to cause crashes though, hence relanding it.



Original CL description:

> HasPendingActivity() is currently used an approximation to check

> whether a wrapper for an ActiveScriptWrappable is still alive.

> However, the presence of activity doesn't necessarily mean that the

> wrapper is not gone. Since Blink knows how to recreate wrappers

> anyway, the CL optimistically drops wrappers with pending activity.

>

> The rate of ASWs with pending activity is very minor: 0% on

> Speedometer2 and 2% on cnn:2021. The CL shouldn't lead to an increase

> in recreation rate.

>

> The CL is a prerequisite for the parallel wrapper reclamation feature.



> Bug: 1432840

entry.title: Replace DeviceAuthenticator::Authenticate with ::AuthenticateWithMessage
entry.content:
This CL is part of a bigger refactoring process of the

DeviceAuthenticator class.



Authenticate was a method which was only used on Android, while all

other platforms used AuthenticateWithMessage. Since Authenticate

doesn't have anymore more parameters than AuthenticateWithMessage, we

are able to unify the cross-platform API by using only

AuthenticateWithMessage.



Design doc for refactoring: http://docs/document/d/15E8t2BcmN241P-1xpLzYXwROrTzzb1-fS9LnXRnHRKc?resourcekey=0-MgxW9Z7T5rY5AzhcyTg__w#heading=h.xgjl2srtytjt .

entry.content:
//content/common/input



This refactoring is a part of bigger project to handle input on viz

thread (go/input-on-viz). We are moving input related interfaces that

RenderWidgetHostImpl uses to //content/common/input. This would provide

a single stack in //content/common/input that we quickly enter in either

the browser or GPU viz which would allow for relatively clean movement

of code. GPU process can link in the same input stack and forward the

data to the renderer using the same code.

entry.title: graphite: Fix OneCopyCanvasCapture fallback path for WebGPU
entry.content:
Graphite currently uses the fallback path for canvas capture after

attempting OneCopyCanvasCapture and failing due to lack of multi-planar

rendering support in Dawn. For WebGPU, this means that canvas current

texture is released which later prevents the fallback path from working

when the canvas is used in an offscreen mode only (e.g. display: none).



This CL fixes that by making GetLastWebGPUMailboxTextureAndSize() return

the current swap buffer if it's available. A pixel test is included as

well. The CL includes a minor fix to CopyToVideoFrame to ensure that the

swap buffer sync token is only replaced if the frame pool copy succeeds.



Bug: 1486555

entry.title: change raw_ptr to WeakPtr in PersistedTabDataAndroid::DeferredRequest
entry.content:
Delaying PersistedTabDataAndroid requests until deferred startup

is a performance optimization to minimize the likelihood of

the system being too busy at startup. However, it did not take

into account that a TabAndroid could be destroyed in the period between

when it was queued and the request was executed. We should use

WeakPtr to account for the TabAndroid potentially no longer existing

when it is processed on the delayed PersistedTabDataAndroid queue.

entry.title: Don't use PROCESS_MODE_BACKGROUND_BEGIN
entry.content:
SetPriorityClass with PROCESS_MODE_BACKGROUND_BEGIN has an undocumented

quirk that it restricts the working set of the process to 32 MiB. This

means that for every page faulted in another page must be trimmed. This

can make banal memory operations almost arbitrarily expensive. One ETW

trace from a customer showed 99% of CPU time in setup.exe spent in

KiPageFault with just 1% of CPU time spent doing actual work. This

32-MiB capping was reproduced in a test app - details in the bug -

which showed up to a 400x slowdown from putting a process in this

background mode.



This issue has been discovered a few times (see the mozilla bug here:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1476365) but is still not

acknowledged in Microsoft's documentation.



Call stacks from the customer trace show that the

AdjustProcessPriority call in InstallProducts is the culprit. I chose

to change the call in RepeatDeleteOldVersions to use the thread

version just-in-case.



Various things were renamed to reflect that we are now changing

thread priority instead of process priority.



TL;DR - never call this:

SetPriorityClass(GetCurrentProcess(), PROCESS_MODE_BACKGROUND_END);



Bug: 1475179, 1396155

Change-Id: Ibe47e19f11c64f6afe723b106f9977345903b025

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4894757

Commit-Queue: Bruce Dawson

Reviewed-by: S Ganesh

Reviewed-by: Greg Thompson

entry.title: Revert "Add ScopedGSignal for managing GLib signal lifetime"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 15eaed5fd66be5a76ea620b08ab08ad5e6e1d712.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/1487625



Original change's description:

> Add ScopedGSignal for managing GLib signal lifetime

>

> Currently, g_signal_connect() is used in //remoting, //ui/gtk,

> //net //third_party/webrtc, and //content/browser/accessibility.

> In almost all cases, the signal isn't disconnected when receiving

> objects are destroyed, which can lead to use-after-frees.

>

> This CL adds ScopedGSignal for safer management of GLib signal

> lifetime since proper management of GLib signals is surprisingly

> tricky: g_signal_handler_disconnect() should be called when the

> signal is no longer needed, but if the sender is deallocated

> before disconnecting, a crash will occur in GLib. Therefore we

> also need to listen for sender destruction. However, this

> creates some more problems since GLib may run the destruction

> callback asynchronously after we've disconnected from the signal,

> so we also need to carefully remove the destruction callback

> in the appropriate places.

>

> Followup CLs will convert usages of g_signal_connect() to

> ScopedGSignal, and a presubmit check will be added to prevent

> new usages of g_signal_connect().

>

> Change-Id: I485a188c915ea79910dad181eddda5eed075e9c0

> Bug: None

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4885026

> Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

> Commit-Queue: Thomas Anderson

> Auto-Submit: Thomas Anderson

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1202336}

entry.title: Revert "Remove User-Agent reduction disable override on WebView"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0a592c3bc2ddbd1fa0dd6b91b1ffa5611b113510.



Reason for revert: Initially we thought Webview constructs its own user-agent without calling component embedder_support APIs. However, WebView use embedder_support::GetProductAndVersion() to get the product version, if we remove this disable override, the minor version will reduced in Webview user-agent. Luckily, We haven't receive any issue since removing this flag starting M116.



Original change's description:

> Remove User-Agent reduction disable override on WebView

>

> User-Agent Reduction phase feature flags were used to control user-agent reduction phases in Chrome components/embedder_support, WebView has its own GetUserAgent API on AwContentBrowserClient.

>

> This CL removes the unnecessary disabled overrides for user-agent reduction phase feature flags.

>

entry.content:

Now, this and follow-up CLs will remove the test usages, before

PDM::SetProfiles...() can be removed. This is desirable, because

PDM::SetProfiles...() relies on a hack called "enforced modifications",

which we'll be able to remove as a result. See doc linked in the bug.



SetProfiles() overwrites all existing profiles in the PDM. In most

unit tests, where no prior profiles exist, this can simply be replaced

by one or more AddProfile() calls.

entry.title: Remove PDM::SetProfiles..() use in manual testing importer.
entry.content:
When importing profiles for testing via the command line flag, all

existing profiles are overwritten. This is currently implemented using

PDM::SetProfiles..(). Since we're about to remove this function, this

call is converted to a series of RemoveByGUID() and AddProfile() calls.



This is more verbose than the current way, and arguably the only usage

where SetProfiles() would actually make sense. However, the added

complexity here is worth the simplifications this allows in the PDM.



existing tests for this code, because this logic depends on command line

entry.title: immersive fs mac: fix invisible save dialog issue
entry.content:
In the immersive fullscreen mode on Mac, the save dialog is hidden

behind the print preview dialog. This issue is likely due to the save dialog being a descendant of `NSToolbarFullscreenWindow`. This AppKit

internal window typically does not host client-provided children, which

may confuse AppKit.



To fix this, this CL attaches the save dialog to its `sheetParent` using

`addChildWindow` and subsequently detaches it using `removeChildWindow`.

This seems to bring the save dialog above its parent.



Bug: 1484058

entry.title: TransferableResource allocation attribution
entry.content:
Currently during Viz's Surface Eviction, the Renderer can be holding onto TransferabelResources. We determined in crbug.com/1477385 that

some resources cannot simply be dropped during an eviction.

WebGL/WebGPU have different lifetime expectations.



We want to confirm the current memory scope of the retentions. To

support this we want to label the TransferableResource, so that

at eviction time we can attribute the memory to the various resource

types. To then pursue reclamation where possible



Bug: 1449274

"independent" logs. This CL switches to use it for all allocators,

other kinds of PMA files handled by FileMetricsProvider, such as

"active" files (e.g. Crashpad).



Something similar could be done for subprocess metrics as well (to

be considered as a follow up).

entry.title: Gracefully fail when CreateRequestHandler() is called twice
entry.content:
When PrefetchResponseReader::CreateRequestHandler() is called

for the second time, instead of CHECK()ing, gracefully fail by

returning null handler if `body_` is null for non-redirect cases.



This CL adds a unit test to confirm that, when

`CreateRequestHandler()` is called multiple times,

PrefetchURLLoaderInterceptor doesn't crash and

gracefully falls back.



This CL leaves DumpWithoutCrashing() for investigating

the cause of crbug.com/1483599.



Bug: 1483599, 1449360

entry.title: [iOS] Fix username reuse checks for Password Bottom Sheet
entry.content:
This CL lazy initializes the "_usernamesWithSameDomainDict" member,

so that the password reuse check related data structure is properly

initialized.



Because [PasswordDetailsMediator initWithPasswords:...] receives a

potentially newly constructed IOSChromePasswordCheckManager object,

immediately initializing this structure can often happen too fast,

causing it to be initialized before the async process to fetch the

data from password stores has completed, which causes the

"_usernamesWithSameDomainDict" member to be empty, which causes the

username reuse checks to fail.



Bug: 1422351

entry.title: [Incognito - NTP] Wrap the cr-tooltip-icon with a div to enable hiding
entry.content:
of the icon.



It turns out the tooltip icon is attached with "flex: none" which will

override the hidden state. We set the CSS here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page_incognito_guest/incognito_tab.css;l=120-122;drc=3e905171807da64794977dcc19cf8e29ee914cbd



We can simply wrap the "cr-tooltip-icon" component within a div that is

tagged with the hidden value and it will actually hide all it's sub

children.



See

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/23772673/hidden-property-does-not-work-with-flex-box/23941712#23941712

for reference.

entry.title: Fix CPU calculation for PageResource UKM using Resource Attribution
entry.content:
Moves the use of CPUMeasurementMonitor inside PageTimelineCPUMonitor

when the kUseResourceAttributionCPUMonitor feature param is enabled.



Now with the feature, PageTimelineCPUMonitor wraps

CPUMeasurementMonitor and returns the percentage of CPU used between

calls to it (so, between ticks of a 2 minute timer). Without the

feature, it does the same calculation itself.



This also changes PageTimelineCPUMonitor to use ResourceContext

instead of ExecutionContext as map keys, even with the feature

disabled, since this won't affect the algorithm used and allows more

shared code.



R=agale

entry.title: [iOS] Remove BlockToOpenURL().
entry.content:
The settings utility function BlockToOpenURL returns a block which

accepts a URL parameter and then opens it. All of the dependencies for

this logic are injected into the utility. It was used in four places,

and in three of them, the block was immediately invoked, so it was

just a complicated way of calling a function.



That utility function is removed in this CL, and call sites just

directly open the URL using the same two lines of code that would

be executed in the block. For the one case where the block was used

in a completion handler, it's now encapsulated in a method call.



Since this was the only method in the settings_utils file, that file

is removed.

entry.title: Move //content/browser/renderer_host/input/tap_suppression_controller.h
entry.content:
to //content/common/input



This refactoring is a part of bigger project to handle input on viz

thread (go/input-on-viz). We are moving input related interfaces that

RenderWidgetHostImpl uses to //content/common/input. This would provide

a single stack in //content/common/input that we quickly enter in either

the browser or GPU viz which would allow for relatively clean movement

of code. GPU process can link in the same input stack and forward the

data to the renderer using the same code.

entry.title: Fix DCHECK failure on startup when restoring tabs.
entry.content:
When "Continue where you left off" is enabled, developer builds hit a

DCHECK on browser start in LoadRestoredTabIfVisible

(browser_tabrestore.cc) when checking if the WebContents' size equals

BrowserWindow::GetContentsSize. This happens when initially_hidden in

AddRestoredTabImpl is true, and thus the WebContents' size is never

set. To fix this, this patch sets the WebContents' size unconditionally.



The DCHECK would also be hit when running

BrowserTabRestoreTest.DelegateRestoreTabDisposition and

BrowserTabRestoreTest.RecentTabsMenuTabDisposition locally. Not sure

why they were not failing on the bots; maybe because they have no

monitor and so BrowserWindow::GetContentsSize is 0 anyway?

entry.title: Remove old dchecks in FrameSequenceTracker
entry.content:
There were a series of dchecks in FrameSequenceTracker used to validate

the initial metrics, and to look for edge cases in dev builds.



There have been changes to how Viz clients, such as the Renderer and

VideoFrameSubmitter interact with embedding changes and teardown.



We can now reuse the client with the same Viz BeginFrameSource, but

with a different embedding. Such as when entering Picture-in-Picture

mode. Which also changes sequence teardown.



We also support on Android WebView the generation of multiple frames

per VSync, making a separate dcheck invalid.



This change removes these invalid dchecks. We also update

UpdateTrackedFrameData to handle receiving a 0 delta. Due to

re-embedding in the same BeginFrameSource.



Bug: 1484520, 1483222, 1479315, 1472081

>

entry.title: Prevent content analysis on web pages that don't accept drag and drop.
entry.content:
Before this patch, when a drag and drop operation ends, the browser

process determines if a content analysis is necessary and performs it

before sending any data to the renderer. Once the data reaches the

renderer process, the process determines whether the page accepts drops.

If not, the page is not given the data and Chrome performs some default

action, like opening a new tab. Since the page never receives the data,

there was no need to analyze it in the first place.



With this patch, the renderer returns to the browser the document's

requested drop operation as well as the renderer's final determination

of the drop operation. The latter, which is already returned and is

used to choose the visual representation of the drag, is used as

before. The former is used in the browser's drop handler to know if

the document is interested in the drop. If not, content analysis can

be skipped and the browser can perform its default action without giving

the data to the web page.



Note that even if the document expresses interest in the drop, it may

still choose not to handle it. In this case, chrome should still

perform any appropriate default action.



See design doc for detailed discussion:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1X9mUtD4gO8rdJBb81sGUCQoUDMsrYD71gLTplzOkQ-Q/edit





Bug: b:247512773

Change-Id: I0754a9b61e5d31937cfef83353cb2a52be25a536

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4814086

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Commit-Queue: Roger Tawa

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1202569}

entry.title: Don't prefix-filter manual fallback suggestions.
entry.content:
Suggestions are filtered by prefix-matching against the triggering

field's value. http://crbug.com/1478986 explains why this shouldn't be

the case for suggestions triggered through manual fallbacks.



This CL makes this change by parameterizing ASG::

GetSuggestionsForProfiles() with the AutofillSuggestionTriggerSource.

Based on it, the correct field_content value can be passed to ASG::

GetProfilesToSuggest() and no filtering is applied for manual fallback

suggestions.

If the user starts typing after triggering manual fallback suggestions,

filtering is applied again, since this is treated as a separate

AskForValuesToFill() event, that regenerates the suggestions.



If a suggestion is selected, the triggering field's value is

overwritten. This is already the case due to the logic in the BAM.

If the triggering field is already autofilled, selecting a suggestion

only overwrites the triggering field's content, not the content of

other autofilled fields in the form. This is already the case too

and is not touched by this CL. An offline discussion with PMs confirmed

that this shouldn't change for manual fallbacks.



Demo: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjAyNDAyNzk4NTQxMjA5Nnw2NWQ5ZWEzYy0xNQ



Bug: 1446318

Fixed: 1478986

Change-Id: I73b01caface25fff68d6143e99a58afd9501a673
